items.title: Logging Into Mac Lab Computers
items.summary: How to sign into Victory Hall lab Macs, including what to do if your password isn’t working.
body: Use these steps to sign into a lab Mac with your Mercy account.
steps: Wake the computer and wait for the login window to appear.
Enter your Mercy username and password (the same as other campus systems).
If you see an error, make sure Caps Lock is off and try again.
If you still cannot sign in, wait 60 seconds and try once more before contacting support.

items.title: Connecting to Campus Wi-Fi on macOS
items.summary: Connect your laptop to Mercy Wi-Fi and avoid common certificate and captive-portal issues.
body: Follow these steps on your personal Mac to connect to campus Wi-Fi.
steps: Click the Wi-Fi icon in the menu bar and select the campus network.
When prompted, enter your Mercy username and password.
If you see a certificate warning, verify it is issued by the university and click Continue.
Open a web browser; if a login page appears, complete any additional sign-in steps shown.

items.title: Backing Up Your Session at the End of the Night
items.summary: Where to save your Pro Tools/Logic sessions, how to copy to external drives, and what to do before power-down.
body: At the end of every session, make sure your work is backed up before you leave.
steps: Save your project in Pro Tools, Logic, or your DAW of choice.
Copy your session folder to your approved external drive or cloud location.
Confirm the copied folder contains audio files and session files (not just shortcuts).
Only after you’ve verified the backup should you log out and shut down the computer.

items.title: No Sound in Logic Pro (Control Room)
items.summary: Quick checklist for when Logic plays, meters move, but nothing comes out of the speakers.
body: If Logic is playing but you don’t hear audio in the control room, walk through this checklist.
steps: Confirm the studio monitor volume and interface volume are turned up.
In Logic, check that the Output device matches the studio’s audio interface.
Verify the master fader is not muted and that its output is set to the main stereo pair.
If you still have issues, load a known-good session or template to rule out routing problems.

items.title: Resetting Studio Headphone Mixes
items.summary: How to reset headphone sends and verify cabling when the booth or live-room mix is missing.
body: If someone in the booth can’t hear themselves, use these steps to reset the headphone mix.
steps: Check that the headphone amp is powered on and the channel volume is up.
In the DAW or console, verify that the correct send is routed to the headphone output.
Test with a known-good set of headphones and cable to rule out hardware issues.
If the issue persists, reset the routing to the standard template and try again.

items.title: Camera Checkout Overview
items.summary: What to expect when borrowing camera kits, including return times and what must be in the case.
body: Review this checklist before you check out or return a camera kit.
steps: Confirm all listed items are present in the case before you leave the office.
Do a quick scratch recording on the camera to confirm cards and batteries are working.
On return, clean obvious fingerprints or dust and neatly repack all accessories.
Report any damaged or missing items to staff when you return the kit.

items.title: Backing Up Camera Cards Before You Leave the Lab
items.summary: Checklist for copying footage from SD cards to your drive and verifying before formatting cards.
body: Always back up media before handing cards back or reusing them.
steps: Insert the SD card and wait for it to mount on the desktop.
Copy the entire card structure (folders and files) to your external drive.
Verify that key clips play correctly from the backup location.
Only after verification should you eject the card and return or reformat it.

items.title: Room Reset Checklist (Any Studio or Lab)
items.summary: Simple end-of-session checklist for leaving any space ready for the next person.
body: Use this quick reset checklist before you leave any shared space.
steps: Push in chairs and return furniture to its default layout.
Put away microphones, stands, cables, and adapters in their labeled locations.
Log out of any accounts on the computer and close all applications.
Remove trash and personal items so the next person starts with a clear space.
